meanings.definition: Transfer (something) back to the original place or owner.
meanings.sent1: She retransferred the book to the library after borrowing it.
meanings.sent2: The lost dog was retransferred to its grateful owner by the kind neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand retransferred the pumpkin back into a carriage!
meanings.sent4: Her smile retransferred the gloomy atmosphere into one of joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The key retransferred the locked door into an open pathway.

meanings.definition: Transfer (something) again to a different recipient.
meanings.sent1: He retransferred the package to the correct address this time.
meanings.sent2: The funds were retransferred to a new account for security reasons.
meanings.sent3: The mistake was so funny that they retransferred the story to their friends.
meanings.sent4: Her words retransferred the blame from him to her in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The wind retransferred the fallen leaves to dance in the air once more.
